alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Delaware; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 11:24AM EDT until July 16 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL BUCKS, NORTHEASTERN DELAWARE, SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY, AND NORTHWESTERN PHILADELPHIA COUNTIES... At 1124 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Norristown, East Norriton, Conshohocken, Hatboro, Ambler, Jenkintown, Narberth, Rockledge, Abington, Bryn Athyn, and Ivyland. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 330 and 346. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 330 and 342. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 11 and 19. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 22. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
